content: What is the shell command to display the contents of a file in reverse order? Please provide the command using the appropriate shell syntax.

To display the contents of a file in reverse order using the shell, you can use the `tac` command, which is the reverse of `cat`. If you want to reverse the lines of a file, you can simply use:

```bash
tac filename.txt
```

If you want to reverse the entire content of the file, character by character, you can use a combination of `rev` and `tac`:

```bash
tac filename.txt | rev
```

This command will first reverse the line order with `tac` and then reverse the characters in each line with `rev`. Make sure to replace `filename.txt` with the actual name of your file.
